snippet: Mitt Romney can’t admit that the auto bailout helped Detroit and America, so instead he invents problems with it.
abstract: Editorial criticizes Mitt Romney for continuing to broadcast outrageously deceitful ads in Ohio attacking successful auto bailout, despite protests from car manufacturers; contends that it takes especially dishonest candidate to simply dial up volume on a lie and keep repeating it, charging that tactic provides grim preview of what kind of president he would be.
lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney can’t admit that the auto bailout helped Detroit and America, so instead he invents problems with it.
